title: WeWork’s Parent Paid With Stock for Some Acquisitions, and Investors in Those Startups Aren’t Happy
text:
WeWork’s parent went on a buying spree before its planned initial public offering, using its highly valued private shares to finance purchases of other venture-backed startups. Now, these startups and their investors are left holding shares that are likely worth a lot less than they bargained for.

We Co. has faced a tumultuous few weeks since the company revealed its IPO filing to the public in August. The company has postponed its planned IPO as investors raise concerns about its governance and losses. Its valuation toppled...
description: WeWork’s parent went on a buying spree before filing to go public, using its highly valued private shares to finance purchases of other venture-backed startups. Now, these startups and their investors are left holding shares that are worth a lot less than what they bargained for.
